dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kaspi.kz just announced a partnership with Alipay+.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: the website just announced a partnership with Alipay+.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joint Stock Company Kaspi.kz (Kaspi.kz) (Nasdaq: KSPI), which operates the Kaspi.kz Super App for consumers and Kaspi Pay Super App for merchants, today announces a new partnership with Alipay + to enable Kaspi.kz customers to pay using the Kaspi.kz Super App and QR code, throughout China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's huge. So now, uh, Kazakhstanis traveling in China can pay using the Kaspi Super App.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's huge. So now, uh, Kazakhstanis traveling in China can pay using the Kaspi Super App.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When travelling in China, Kazakhstanis no longer need to take cash or a card with them. Now, using the Kaspi.kz Super App, purchases in Chinese stores, cafes, taxis and more than 80 million points throughout China can be paid for by QR code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. They won't need cash or cards—just scan a QR code at over 82 million points across China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. They won't need cash or cards-just scan a Q R code at over eighty two million points across China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, using the Kaspi.kz Super App, purchases in Chinese stores, cafes, taxis and more than 80 million points throughout China can be paid for by QR code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's… like, stores, cafes, even taxis, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's... like, stores, cafes, even taxis, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, using the Kaspi.kz Super App, purchases in Chinese stores, cafes, taxis and more than 80 million points throughout China can be paid for by QR code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, pretty much everywhere. Mikhail Lomtadze, their CEO, mentioned how customers kept asking for easier payments abroad.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, pretty much everywhere. Mikhail Lomtadze, their C E O, mentioned how customers kept asking for easier payments abroad.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: CEO and Co-founder of Kaspi.kz Mikhail Lomtadze, commented: Many Kazakhstanis work, study and vacation in China. We constantly receive feedback from our customers - how nice it would be to pay for purchases abroad as easily as in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it makes sense. A lot of people from Kazakhstan work and vacation in China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it makes sense. A lot of people from Kazakhstan work and vacation in China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: CEO and Co-founder of Kaspi.kz Mikhail Lomtadze, commented: Many Kazakhstanis work, study and vacation in China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Venetia Li from Ant International said they're excited to partner with the leading Super App in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Venetia Li from Ant International said they're excited to partner with the leading Super App in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Venetia Lee, Greater China General Manager of Ant International, commented: Alipay+ is thrilled to announce our partnership with the first and leading e-wallet Super App in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So how does it actually work for users?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So how does it actually work for users?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You just open the Kaspi app, select Alipay+, and either show your QR code or scan the seller's.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You just open the Kaspi app, select Alipay+, and either show your Q R code or scan the seller's.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To pay for purchases, Kaspi.kz customers just need to open the Kaspi.kz app, select the AliPay+ service and let the seller scan their QR code or alternatively buyers can scan the seller's QR code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's super straightforward. No extra steps.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's super straightforward. No extra steps.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's all part of their mission to improve daily life through mobile products.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's all part of their mission to improve daily life through mobile products.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kzs mission is to improve peoples lives by developing innovative mobile products and services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, they've got that two-sided model—consumers and merchants both covered.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, they've got that two-sided model-consumers and merchants both covered.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To deliver upon this, we operate a unique, two-sided Super App model Kaspi.kz Super App for consumers and Kaspi Pay Super App for merchants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, you know, being listed on Nasdaq since 2023 gives them that global credibility.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, you know, being listed on Nasdaq since twenty twenty three gives them that global credibility.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz has been listed on Nasdaq since January 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely feels like a win for cross-border mobile payments.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely feels like a win for cross-border mobile payments.

artist_script:
En route to Beijing, a new digital bridge is being built between Kazakhstan and China.
HostA: Kaspi.kz just announced a partnership with Alipay+.
HostB: Oh, that’s huge. So now, uh, Kazakhstanis traveling in China can pay using the Kaspi Super App.
HostA: Exactly. They won’t need cash or cards—just scan a QR code at over 82 million points across China.
HostB: That’s… like, stores, cafes, even taxis, right?
HostA: Yeah, pretty much everywhere. Mikhail Lomtadze, their CEO, mentioned how customers kept asking for easier payments abroad.
HostB: I mean, it makes sense. A lot of people from Kazakhstan work and vacation in China.
HostA: And Venetia Li from Ant International said they’re excited to partner with the leading Super App in Kazakhstan.
HostB: So how does it actually work for users?
HostA: You just open the Kaspi app, select Alipay+, and either show your QR code or scan the seller’s.
HostB: That’s super straightforward. No extra steps.
HostA: And it’s all part of their mission to improve daily life through mobile products.
HostB: Right, they’ve got that two-sided model—consumers and merchants both covered.
HostA: Plus, you know, being listed on Nasdaq since 2023 gives them that global credibility.
HostB: Definitely feels like a win for cross-border mobile payments.
